content.text:
# Draft:President's College, Minuwangoda

----
'''President's College, Minuwangoda (), formerly known as Japalawaththa Central College''', is a co-educational government school in Minuwangoda, Sri Lanka. It was established in 1979 by Bennet Gunasekera, then Member of Parliament for the Minuwangoda Electoral District.
History
The school was founded on February 9, 1979, as Japalawaththa Central College to expand secondary education opportunities in the Minuwangoda area. It initially admitted 225 students and operated with six teachers. The school was upgraded to a 1A category provincial school on September 1, 1979. The first cohort of students sat for the G.C.E. Ordinary Level examination in 1983.
Overview
President's College, Minuwangoda serves students from grades 6 to 13 and has an enrollment of approximately 2,750 students. The school employs around 180 staff members and offers instruction in both Sinhala and English.
